item.title: Perimeter railing - Hoblingwell/Petersham Drive, 9th January
item.description:
A pole from the perimeter railing was found opposite number 27 Petersham Drive. This seems to have come from opposite number 19 Petersham Drive where a pole was missing. (Please see attached photo showing gap.) This pole has been replaced in the posts however it is not central so is loose and not secure. Many of the poles in the vicinity do not abut centrally within the posts and so are not secure and are easily removed. Tracks were found through the gap opposite 19 Petersham Drive so it appears that this pole was deliberately removed for access with a quad bike. (Please see attached photo showing tracks.) Please could the railing in this area be properly secured?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Petersham Drive, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: BV08 WFZ Nissan silver, 9th January
item.description:
The car is illegally declared as sorn to the DVLA to avoid paying tax and mot The car is not taxed and no mot Ongoing for over 6 months

item.title: Over grown hedge, 9th January
item.description:
This hedge is in a school road and opposite car park spaces which are always in use. You can only fit one pedestrian on the pavement at a time because the hedge is so overgrown. Itâ€™s hard for people with prams to get down. It would be better if it was cut back to the same level as the brick wall to make it easier and safer for children and adults to walk to school and back. I believe this hedge belongs to 33 Sheldon Road, Bexelyheath, DA7 4PB. This hedge has been like since I moved into the area in 2023. I hope this is something no you can help with, thank you for taking the time to read this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheldon Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collection of rubbish and leaves, 9th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Doveney Close, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: On the corner of Monmouth Street and Neal Street. Infront of the Punjab Restaurant., 9th January
item.description:
The road patch on the corner of Neal Street and Monmouth Street is in poor condition, breaking down causing a tripping hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Neal Street, Bloomsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking, 9th January
item.description:
Over the past year people have been parking on left hand side of the road, around 5 onwards the road is rammed with cars. If you drive into the road and meet a car coming out I sometimes have to reverse all the way back around a bend with extremely tight parking , there is no where to pull in to let a car pass, it has never been like this before in all the years I have lived here . 3 times today I drove half way down the road only to have to reverse out again to let traffic come out of the road because there is no where to pull in. Yellow lines might be a good idea
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chipstead Road, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large volumes of waste attracting virmin, 9th January
item.description:

item.title: The phasing is wrong., 9th January
item.description:
On the junction turning left from Turney Road on to Dulwich Village it takes 2 or 3 phases for the lights to turn green. This results in cars becoming impatient and going through red lights - very dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich Village, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
